item.title: Donna add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "It is easy enough to be friendly to one's friends. But to befriend the one who regards himself as your enemy is the quintessence of true religion. The other is mere business." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Donna add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I believe in the fundamental truth of all great religions of the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Donna add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Donna add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "The purpose of all the major religious traditions is not to construct big temples on the outside, but to create temples of goodness and compassion inside, in our hearts." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Donna add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "It's hard for me, a Jew, to stay in the moment. Without the past, where is the guilt? And without the future, where is the dread? And without guilt and dread, who am I?" -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Donna add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Donna add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Donna add a quote by Daniel Wallace
item.description: "When a man's stories are remembered, then he is immortal." -- Daniel Wallace

item.title: Donna add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Donna add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Donna add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Donna add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Donna add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Donna add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Donna add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Donna add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "We were not a hugging people. In terms of emotional comfort it was our belief that no amount of physical contact could match the healing powers of a well made cocktail." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Donna add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I am thankful for laughter, except when milk comes out of my nose." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Donna add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I can't fight. I was once run over by a car with a flat tire, being pushed by two guys." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Donna add a quote by E. Welty
item.description: "A good snapshot keeps a moment from running away." -- E. Welty

item.title: Donna add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "More tears are shed over answered prayers than unanswered ones." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Donna add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Life is a moderately good play with a badly written third act." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Donna add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Donna add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Young men think old men are fools; but old men know young men are fools." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Donna add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "I don't care what anybody says about me as long as it isn't true." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Donna add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "What I found does the most good is just to get into a taxi and go to Tiffany's. It calms me down right away, the quietness and the proud look of it;nothing very bad could happen to you there. " -- Truman Capote

item.title: Donna add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "It is no shame to have a dirty face- the shame comes when you keep it dirty." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Donna add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "She had only one flaw. She was perfect, otherwise whe was perfect." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Donna add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Donna add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "The statistics on sanity are that one out of every four people is suffering from a mental illness. Look at your 3 best friends. If they're ok, then it's you." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Donna add a quote by Kent M. Keith
item.description:
"The Paradoxical Commandments
People are illogical, unreasonable, and self-centered. Love them anyway.
If you do good, people will accuse you of selfish ulterior motives. Do good anyway.
If you are successful, you will win false friends and true enemies. Succeed anyway.
The good you do today will be forgotten tomorrow. Do good anyway.
Honesty and frankness make you vulnerable. Be honest and frank anyway.
The biggest men and women with the biggest ideas can be shot down by the smallest men and women with the smallest minds. Think big anyway.
People favor underdogs but follow only top dogs. Fight for a few underdogs anyway.
What you spend years building may be destroyed overnight. Build anyway.
People really need help but may attack you if you do help them. Help people anyway.
Give the world the best you have and you'll get kicked in the teeth. Give the world the best you have anyway." -- Kent M. Keith
